docs.snippet: The Boston Celtics ended their franchise-record losing streak at 18 games last night, getting 32 points from Paul Pierce and 21 from Gerald Green to defeat the Milwaukee Bucks, 117-97....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Boston Celtics ended their franchise-record losing streak at 18 games last night, getting 32 points from Paul Pierce and 21 from Gerald Green to defeat the Milwaukee Bucks, 117-97.

headline.main: Celtics Snap Skid at 18 by Beating the Bucks
headline.print_headline: Celtics Snap Skid at 18 By Beating the Bucks

docs.snippet: The mayor of Las Vegas, Oscar Goodman, confirmed yesterday that N.B.A. Commissioner David Stern was willing to listen to a proposal that would enable an N.B.A. team to play in that city.      ''He said: 'The ball is in your court. You make a propo...
docs.lead_paragraph: The mayor of Las Vegas, Oscar Goodman, confirmed yesterday that N.B.A. Commissioner David Stern was willing to listen to a proposal that would enable an N.B.A. team to play in that city. ''He said: 'The ball is in your court. You make a proposal and I'll bring it to my owners in April and they can vote on it,' '' Goodman said.
docs.abstract: Las Vegas (Nev) mayor Oscar Goodman says NBA commissioner David Stern will hear city's proposal to host permanent NBA team (S)

headline.sub: And the Oscar Goes to The Bagger

docs.abstract: Where's the romance, not to mention the sex, in this year's movies?

headline.main: What's Love Got to Do With It?

docs.snippet: Helen Mirren may be an overdog this year, but she's still O.K....
docs.lead_paragraph: Before people get hung up on Helen Mirren winning everything in sight and coming to believe she's royally entitled, it's worth glancing at this story from Reuters and a thought from Tom O'Neil of TheEnvelope.com.
docs.abstract: Helen Mirren may be an overdog this year, but she's still O.K.

headline.main: The Queen Was Not Ever Thus

docs.snippet: The difference between surgery and losing at the Oscars....
docs.lead_paragraph: Little Gold Men points us to an item reporting that best actress nominee Judi Dench is opting for knee surgery over attendance at the Oscar ceremony. Not much difference, really, between going under the knife and pretending to smile while losing a competition being watched by the whole world.
docs.abstract: The difference between surgery and losing at the Oscars.

docs.snippet: Hoping for a Mutt and Jeff photo op at this year's Oscars....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Bagger is hoping for an Oscar photo op involving the diminutive Martin Scorsese and the director of "The Lives of Others," German director Florian Henckel von Donnersmarck, who stands stands six-foot-nine. Reuters checks in with a first-time filmmaker who came up big:
docs.abstract: Hoping for a Mutt and Jeff photo op at this year's Oscars.

docs.snippet: Looking for Oscar clues among the shorts....
docs.lead_paragraph: Kris Tapley at InContention has been staring at Oscar-nominated shorts for some tells about how awards might go. Mr. Tapley's got good eyes and soft hands when it comes to Oscar guessery, so you might want to spend some quality time at his site. The Bagger watched the animated shorts, which had their charms, but skipped the daunting DVD of live action shorts, a challenge Mr. Tapley proves equal to.
docs.abstract: Looking for Oscar clues among the shorts.

docs.snippet: Bill Murray in "Little Miss Sunshine," and other fantasies....
docs.lead_paragraph: What if Uncle Frank in "Little Miss Sunshine" had been played by Bill Murray? Check out this what-if list of Oscar magic that never came to pass.
docs.abstract: Bill Murray in "Little Miss Sunshine," and other fantasies.

docs.snippet: Farley Granger remembers Hitchcock and says Leo is the man....
docs.lead_paragraph: On Sunday night, at the British Film Awards viewing party at the Supper Club in New York, a woman who looked to be in her early 70's approached Farley Granger and said: "Years ago I would have attacked you."
docs.abstract: Farley Granger remembers Hitchcock and says Leo is the man.

headline.main: An Oscar Pick From a Star
